articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- Functions were held in different countries in the period from Feb. 7 to 16 on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Seminars on Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" were held by the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea, the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for Study of the Juche-Based Songun Policy and the Indian Intellectuals' Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, and seminars on his exploits and film shows by the Peruvian  Group for the Study of Kimilsungism, the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship and the New Left Movement of Peru.
 Sekou Konate, general secretary of the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea, said that the DPRK has confidently advanced along the road of socialism chosen by itself though socialism collapsed in the Eastern European countries one after another because the Workers' Party of Korea has been guided by the Juche idea. 
 Roberto Carbonel Pezo, chairman of the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for Study of the Juche-Based Songun Policy, noted that the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il has served as the most unique politics because it was set out to meet the need of the era on the basis of the essence of the Juche philosophy and has displayed its vitality.
 V.K. Chopra, chairman of the Indian Intellectuals' Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, noted that the Korean people have firmly protected the dignity of the nation and the sovereignty of the country from the evermore intensified U.S. moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK as they have been guided by the Juche philosophy. 
 Screened at the film shows were Korean films including "The Brilliant History of the Great Leadership" and "The Old Home in Mt. Paektu in All Its Glory".

articles.title: Chairman of Labor Union Arrested by South Korean Police
articles.content:
Chairman of Labor Union Arrested by South Korean Police 
    Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean police arrested Jon Jae Hwan, chairman of the south Korean Federation of Metal Industrial Workers Unions, on Feb. 25, according to KBS of south Korea.
 Police have worked hard to arrest him since they issued a warrant of arrest to him on Jan. 20 on the charge that he led the general strike of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) for the right of the part time workers at the end of last year when he was chairman of the Committee for Emergency Measures of the KCTU.
 Police arrested him when going to attend a meeting of the KCTU to be held in front of the building of the "National Assembly", KBS said.    
 That day more than 150 members of the KCTU held a meeting to denounce the police suppression of him in front of the Yongdungpho police station in Seoul where he is detained.

Sports Contest for Paektusan Cup Closes
articles.content:
Sports Contest for Paektusan Cup Closes 
    Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The Sports Contest for Paektusan Cup, which was opened on the occasion of the February holiday, closed with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Tuesday.
 The April 25 Sports Group won the titles in men's and women's basketball and volleyball events while girls of this group and boys of the Rimyongsu Sports Group came first in football events by displaying a high degree of teamwork and persevering spirit.
 At the ceremony prizes were awarded to the groups and players that proved successful in the contest.    
 Addressing the ceremony, Chairman of the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission Mun Jae Dok called on all the players, coaches and officials to set high goals and steadily acquire sporting methods and technique of Korean style to achieve a signal success in the sports activities for this year.

articles.title: Staff Members of Russian Embassy Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Staff Members of Russian Embassy Help Korean Farmers 
    Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov and staff members of his embassy visited the Korea-Russia Friendship Kochang Cooperative Farm Tuesday to help its members in farm work. 
 They helped farmers in spreading compost on a field. During break they sang songs together and exchanged conversations, deepening the friendship.
 The Russian ambassador said that the DPRK singled out agriculture as the main front of economic construction, wishing the farm success in its agricultural production this year.    
 The Russian diplomats went round the room devoted to the history of the farm and handed materials for farming to it.

Greetings to Libyan Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Libyan Leader
    Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Moammer el Gaddafi, leader of the Great September First Revolution of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of its proclamation.
 The message wished the friendly Libyan people greater progress and prosperity and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the days ahead.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of Uganda
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Uganda
    Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Yoweri Kaguta Museveni on the latter's reelection as president of Uganda.
 The message said that Museveni's reelection as president of Uganda is an expression of the Ugandan people's profound trust and expectation for him, adding that the Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over the great successes made by the Ugandan people in the social and economic fields under the leadership of the president over the last two decades.    
 Expressing the conviction that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will grow stronger and develop in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the president fresh success in his responsible work for the national unity and the prosperity of the country.
